intro: Anthoxanthum odoratum var. pubescens, commonly known as sweet vernal grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its bright yellow inflorescence, which resembles a tuft of hair. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The plant is known for its pleasant, honey-like fragrance, which is most noticeable when the flowers are in bloom.
